{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about the best study design for comparing fat content in expressed breast milk of pre-term infants vs term infants. Pre-term infants are a specific group with different characteristics than term infants. A case control design involves matching cases (pre-term infants) to controls (term infants), but it wouldn't account for changes over time or within individuals. A prospective cohort would allow us to follow both groups over time, which is important for capturing changes in fat content. Longitudinal study also implies following subjects over time.
